title: Were These Bikers Praying for Trump at Walter Reed?

statement: Photographs show over a thousand mail-in ballots discovered in a California landfill.

title: Does a Photo Show Sharks on a Power Line After Hurricane Laura?
subtitle: Sharks and hurricanes are a popular combination among online rumors.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows sharks stuck in power lines after Hurricane Laura in 2020.

title: Does Photo Show the 'Supreme Army General of Antifa'?
subtitle: FBI Director Chris Wray said of antifa that, “It's not a group or an organization. It's a movement or an ideology.”

statement: A photograph shows the "Supreme Army General of Antifa" in Portland.

title: Was a UFO Spotted Over New Jersey?

statement: A video shows a "UFO" flying over New Jersey in September 2020.

title: Does This Video Show Police Brutality in the US?

title: Is This Obama, Fauci, and Gates at a Wuhan Lab in 2015?

title: Does This Photo Show a Full Crowd at Trump's Tulsa Rally?

title: Does Photo Show Aunt Jemima Chained to a Table?

statement: A photograph shows Aunt Jemima chained to a table.

title: Is This a 28-Foot-Long Crocodile That Was Killed in Australia in 1957?

title: Does a Photo Show Trump's Children with Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman?

title: Is This a Picture of a 'Tank Silencer'?

title: Does a Video Show Hong Kong Protesters Using Wearable Projectors to Avoid Facial Recognition?

title: Is This 'Magic Sword' Really Going Through a Toothpick?

title: Is This a Photo of a 'Handmaid's Tale'-Themed Wedding?

title: Were Piles of Rubbish Left in Hyde Park By Global-Warming Protesters?

title: Is This Shopping Aisle Empty Due to Socialism?

title: Is This an 'Abandoned Russian Mental Hospital'?

title: Do These Photographs Show a Nazi Flag and Homophobic Merchandise at a Trump Rally in Pennsylvania?

title: Is This a Photograph of Hurricane Michael?

title: Is This a Photograph of Nazi SS Troops Shooting a Child?

title: Does This Video Show Muslims Being Herded Into a Mobile Gas Chamber?

statement: A video shows a group of Muslims being loaded into a mobile gas chamber.

statement: A photograph shows a mining lift crammed full of “Irish slaves in America.”

title: Does This Photograph Show a Woman Abused by Keith Ellison?
subtitle: Rep. Keith Ellison's former girlfriend has leveled charges of "narcissist abuse" against him, but a picture of a badly injured woman used in a meme shows someone else.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph depicts a former girlfriend badly beaten by Rep. Keith Ellison of Minnesota.

title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford Holding a 'Not My President' Sign?
subtitle: A conservative Facebook page's attempt to smear Christine Blasey Ford used a stock photograph of an entirely different woman.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Christine Blasey Ford holding a sign reading "Not My President" at an anti-Trump protest.

title: Are These Pictures of Pigs on a Farm Flooded by Hurricane Florence?
subtitle: Photographs showing a group of pigs on a flooded farm are real, but they were not taken after Hurricane Florence in 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a group of pigs on a flooded farm after Hurricane Florence.

title: Is This Anderson Cooper Standing in a Ditch While Reporting Hurricane Florence?
subtitle: It's not uncommon for reporters to call upon dramatic skills in the course of conveying the perils of extreme weather phenomena.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs document CNN's Anderson Cooper faking the depths of Hurricane Florence floodwaters.

title: Does This Photograph Show 26 'Corrupt' Politicians Executed by China?
subtitle: Not a picture of 'corrupt' politicians or an execution, although some of the latter followed afterwards.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows 26 corrupt politicians shortly before they were executed in China.

title: Did Nike Release a Line of 'Burned' Sneakers to Clap Back at Protesters?
subtitle: A creative sneaker-based artwork was wrongly associated with later protests against Nike.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Nike released a line of sneakers designed to look as if they had been burned in order get back at consumers who destroyed their products in protest.

title: Is This a Picture of an 'Intense Supercell with a Mass of Tornadoes' in Kansas?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing multiple tornadoes touching down in Kansas is actually a composite image showing the "evolution" of a single tornado.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows multiple tornadoes touching down in Kansas.

title: Is This Dashing Young Man Franklin D. Roosevelt?
subtitle: A 1930s photograph of Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jr., the President's son, is a popular item online but it is often miscaptioned as a picture of his father.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A photograph shows a young Franklin Delano Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States.

title: Does This Video Show Refugees Looting a Café in Spain?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing refugees looting a café in Spain actually captures an incident from 2015 involving students at a university in South Africa.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of refugees looting a café in Spain.

title: Did an Audience Member Scare Trump by Shouting 'Allahu Akbar' at a Rally?
subtitle: A video showing Secret Service surrounding Donald Trump at a 2016 rally is real, but the audio portion was manipulated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an audience member scaring Donald Trump at a rally by screaming "Allahu Akbar."

title: Does This Video Show Six Antifa Members Beating Up a Person During an August 2018 Rally?
subtitle: A year-old video showing a group of Antifascists beating up a right-wing activists in Berkeley, California, was reshared as if it showed a recent incident in Washington D.C.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows six Antifa members beating up an individual during an August 2018 alt-right protest in Washington D.C.

title: Does This Photograph Show ICE Arresting Small Children?
subtitle: Although a photograph of handcuffed children is shared with the claim the youngsters were arrested by ICE, the image is unrelated to immigration.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows ICE agents handcuffing and arresting immigrant children.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Woman About to Be Stoned to Death in Iran?
subtitle: Iran has been criticized by the international community for allowing the use of stoning as a form of capital punishment
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a woman buried up to her neck jsut before being stoned to death in Iran.

title: Does This Photograph Show Clouds Over the California Wildfires?
subtitle: A spectacular image of red-tinted clouds at sunset was repurposed to falsely connect it with 2018 wildfires in California.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows red-tinted clouds over a large wildfire in California.

title: Do Dramatic Videos Show the Earth's Crust “Moving” for the “First Time”?
subtitle: Two unrelated videos, one of a large landslide and the other of a frozen debris flow, have been shared across social media with misleading descriptions.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Videos from Mongolia provide humanity with its first ever view of the Earth's crust moving.

title: Was a Carving of a Modern Bicycle Found Inside an Ancient Temple?
subtitle: A 2,000-year-old carving of a figure riding a modern bicycle was supposedly found inside an ancient temple in India.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A 2,000-year-old carving of a figure riding a modern bicycle was found inside an ancient temple in India.

title: Does This Video Show Injuries Created with Makeup to Fool the Public About Atrocities?
subtitle: A video featuring a Palestinian makeup artist was used as propaganda to claim that reports of atrocities in Syria and Israel had been faked.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows actors creating the appearance of injuries through makeup to deceive the public about reports of atrocities.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Future French Politician as a Shepherd in Morocco?
subtitle: Internet memes falsely used an unrelated image of a Moroccan girl to illustrate the unusual life story of Najat Vallaud-Belkacem.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral photograph shows the former French Education Minister Najat Vallaud-Belkacem as a young girl in Morocco.

title: Did Cars Melt in Saudi Arabia or Kuwait Due to a Heat Wave?
subtitle: Images showing "melted" cars in are real, but the extreme heat came from a nearby construction fire, not the sun.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show cars that started to "melt" due to extremely hot weather in Saudi Arabia or Kuwait.

title: Was This Hallway Designed to Prevent Children from Running?
subtitle: An image showing an optical illusion created with floor tiles is genuine, but it wasn't created to discourage young students from running in the hallways.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an optical illusion on the floor of a school hallway that was designed to prevent children from running.

title: Does This Video Show a Giant Anaconda Getting Caught in a Trap?
subtitle: It's not just the chickens who are scared by what's seen in this video.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a giant anaconda getting stuck in a trap while trying to eat a chicken.

title: Did a Man Save His Friend From a Reptilian Attack with an Elbow Drop?
subtitle: Footage from a video featuring a remote control crocodile (or alligator) was actually a response to a prank created for a YouTube page.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a man saving his friend from an attack by either an alligator or a crocodile.

title: Is an 'Obama Don't Separate Me From My Mommy' Protest Sign Real?
subtitle: A photograph showing protesters holding a sign is real, but the sign is referring to separations due to the deportation of family members in the United States rather than forcibly separating families at the border.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group holding a protest sign reading "Obama don't separate me from my mommy."

title: Were These Children Separated From Their Parents Under Obama?
subtitle: A 2014 photograph of unaccompanied minor immigrants is misleadingly being described as showing children separated from their parents by the Obama administration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image from 2014 shows undocumented children separated from their parents by the Obama administration.

title: Does This Photograph Show Border Agents Forcibly Separating Children From Families?
subtitle: A Pulitzer Prize-winning photograph of a federal agent seizing Elián González was recycled nearly twenty years later with a misleading caption in the wake of a family separation scandal.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Border Patrol agent following President Donald Trump's order to forcibly separate a child from his family.

title: Did 'the Whole of London' Protest in Support of Far-Right Activist Tommy Robinson?
subtitle: A viral photograph showed massive crowds out on the streets of an English city, but the scene was not what far-right supporters claimed it was.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A viral photograph posted in June 2018 shows "the whole of London" protesting on the streets in defense of jailed far-right activist Tommy Robinson.

title: Does This Photo Show a Toddler in a Cage Detained by ICE in 2018?
subtitle: A heart-rending photograph of a crying child in a cage was part of a protest to call attention to immigration practices.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A disturbing photograph depicts a small boy who was detained by ICE in 2018 being held in a cage.

title: Did Justin Trudeau's Eyebrow Fall Off at the G7 Summit?
subtitle: A popular video clip made it appear as if the Canadian prime minister was wearing fake eyebrows at an international conference.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a false eyebrow falling off the face of Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau at the G7 Summit.

title: Did a Mother Deer Sacrifice Herself to Cheetahs to Save Her Fawns?
subtitle: A haunting photograph and a stirring tale of maternal sacrifice: one is real, the other isn't.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows an impala who allowed herself to be captured by cheetahs so her offspring could escape.

title: Does a Photograph of Kidney Stones Show the Effect of Sodas and Energy Drinks?
subtitle: Experts say that blaming soft drinks or energy drinks alone for the formation of kidney stones is dishonest.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A photograph shows kidney stones that were caused by heavy consumption of soft drinks and energy drinks.

title: Was a Texting Driver Found Still Clutching a Phone After a Fatal Car Crash?
subtitle: A photograph of a car crash scene is real, but the accompanying story was evidently manufactured to dissuade people from texting while driving.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Paramedics found the upper half of a woman's body clutching her phone in the aftermath of a car accident caused by texting while driving.

title: Did Natalie Palmer Botes Hunt and Kill These Wolves?
subtitle: Rumors that the daughter of Walter Palmer killed several wolves on a hunting trip are unsubstantiated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Natalie Palmer Botes, the daughter of big game hunter Walter Palmer, with several dead wolves - including one that had recently given birth to cubs.

title: Did a Woman Abandon Her Son on the Street to Appease Her Partner?
subtitle: A video of a woman driving away from her child is real, but the accompanying backstory is nothing more than clickbait fiction.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a woman abandoning her son on the side of the road in order to appease her partner.

title: Does a Photograph Show Germans Protesting High Fuel Prices?
subtitle: The picture in question actually has nothing to do with Germans, fuel prices, or any form of protest.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows millions of Germans abandoning their cars in protest over high gasoline prices.

title: Was Nikola Tesla a Swimming Instructor?
subtitle: An image of an unidentified man on a New York beach in 1898 is frequently described as showing inventor Nikola Tesla.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Nikola Tesla working as a swim instructor on a New York beach near the end of the 19th century.

title: Does This Photograph Show Only White Military Spouses at the White House?
subtitle: A tweet suggesting White House invitations for military spouses were not diverse was based on a few inaccurate assumptions, but it was widely shared anyway.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts a military spouses gathering at the White House, and no people of color were included.

title: Did a Man Carry His Horse Three Miles After It Was Bitten by a Snake?
subtitle: A video of a man carrying a horse is real, but this act of strength had nothing to do with a venomous snake.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man carried his horse for three miles after it was bitten by a venomous snake.

title: Is This an Asian Giant Hornet?
subtitle: Asian giant hornets are real, and large, insects - but a viral photograph purporting to show one actually features a movable insect model.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows an Asian giant hornet, a large insect with a potentially deadly sting.

title: Was a Massive Rat Caught in London?
subtitle: A photograph of a large rat captured in England is real, but it appears that forced perspective made it look larger than it actually was.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a twelve-pound rat that was caught in London.

title: Did an Exorcism Save a House from Destruction During a Hurricane?
subtitle: A viral meme fabricated supernatural involvement in an already remarkable hurricane survival story.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: An exorcism in 1988 saved a house from destruction during Hurricane Ike in 2008.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Man Washing Aborted Fetuses in Brazil?
subtitle: A viral photograph purportedly shows a "pro-lifer" washing aborted fetuses in Rio de Janeiro, but the image appears to have originated elsewhere.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph captures a man washing aborted fetuses in Brazil.

title: Is This Jeffrey Dahmer Next to an Ice Bong?
subtitle: A photograph of a college student standing proudly near a bong made out of snow is frequently shared with a misleading caption.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer standing next to an ice bong.

title: Did a Sperm Whale Die After Swallowing 64 Pounds of Plastic Debris?
subtitle: A photograph of an art installation is frequently attached to genuine reports about a dead whale's washing ashore with trash and debris in its stomach.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a dead sperm whale that washed ashore after swallowing 64 pounds of plastic debris and other trash.

title: Did a Sunbather Catch a Cobra with Her Bare Hands?
subtitle: A video purportedly showing a sunbather grabbing a snake just before it bites her is actually a prank involving a fishing pole and a rubber reptile.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a sunbather catching a snake moments before it bites her.

title: Was Arnold Schwarzenegger Forced to Sleep Outside a Hotel He Had Helped Open?
subtitle: That's gratitude for you!
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Arnold Schwarzenegger slept in a sleeping bag outside a hotel he had once opened, because staff refused to give him a free room.

title: Did a Sick Child's Classmates Refuse to Wish Him a Happy Birthday?
subtitle: A photograph of young child with a rare disease was exploited for likes and retweets on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young boy with a rare disease after his classmates refused to wish him a happy birthday.

title: Is This a 'Short-Tailed Weasel'?
subtitle: An image of a felt doll is frequently shared as if it was a genuine photograph of a particularly toy-like weasel.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a short-tailed weasel.

title: Are These the Northern Lights Seen From Space?
subtitle: A purported photograph of an aurora is actually a screenshot from a computer animation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A viral item gives a genuine glimpse of the aurora borealis (or aurora australis) from far above the planet.

title: Did President Donald Trump Slap the Mayor of Mexico City?
subtitle: A video of Trump slapping World Wrestling Entertainment executive director Vince McMahon at an event was later repurposed with an inaccurate caption.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows President Donald Trump slapping the mayor of Mexico City.

title: Does This Video Show a Car Exploding at a Gas Station Due to Cellphone Use?
subtitle: A video of a fatal explosion at a gas station in Brazil was real, but the tragedy wasn't caused by the reasons assigned to it.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A gas station explosion caught on camera was caused by children using a mobile phone in the backseat of a car.

title: Were These Three World Leaders Friends in High School?
subtitle: A photograph of Angela Merkel at a party as a teenager does not feature Theresa May or Dalia Grybauskaitė.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows world leaders Angela Merkel, Theresa May, and Dalia Grybauskaitė together at a party as teenagers.

title: Stephen Hawking at a Vietnam War Protest?
subtitle: An image misidentifying a man at a Vietnam War protest as Stephen Hawking went viral after the theoretical physicist's death in March 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Stephen Hawking at a Vietnam War protest in 1968.

title: Was Ellen DeGeneres Surrounded by Armed Guards at an Anti-Gun Rally?
subtitle: An image showing the comedian and television host next to a possibly armed guard is real, but the photograph was not taken at an anti-gun rally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Ellen DeGeneres surrounded by guards with guns - at an anti-gun rally.

title: Is This an Armed Teacher Protecting Students at an Israeli School?
subtitle: An image purportedly showing an teacher with a gun slung across her back while watching over students is often shared with misleading claims about security protocols within the country.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a teacher carrying guns at a school in Israel.

title: Did Nancy Pelosi Scold a Democrat for Standing at the State of the Union Address?
subtitle: Images showing Nancy Pelosi pointing a finger at a Linda Sanchez are authentic, but a video of the event told a different story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi scolding a fellow Democrat for standing during the State of the Union.

title: Does This Photograph Show Security Escorting Andrew McCabe Out of the FBI Building?
subtitle: A photograph showing the former deputy director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation with a group of armed officers is real, but it is not recent and does not show him being thrown or escorted out.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows former deputy director of the FBI Andrew McCabe being escorted out of the building by security after he left his position in January 2018.

title: Is This a Rat Showering Like a Person?
subtitle: A seemingly innocuous video shows neither a rat nor a shower.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a rat washing itself as though it were a human taking a shower.

title: Does a Video Show a Muslim Engaging in a 'Halal Slash'?
subtitle: Years-old CCTV footage that captured a stabbing in London was used to make discriminatory claims about Muslims.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a Muslim man randomly picking people in London to "halal slash" with a knife for fun.

title: Did a Woman Wear This Revealing Dress to a Hollywood Event to Protest Sexual Harassment?
subtitle: A photograph showing model Giulia Salemi in a revealing dress is real, but it has little to do with Hollywood or sexual harassment and were taken long before the start of the #MeToo movement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an actress in a revealing dress amidst protests against sexual harassment in Hollywood.

title: Is This Our Congress Hard at Work?
subtitle: A collage purportedly showing members of the US Congress sleeping at their desks actually shows various Brazilian politicians napping over the years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image collage shows various members of the United States Congress "hard at work" while sleeping at their desks.

title: Is This Family Grieving a Soldier Killed in Action?
subtitle: President Donald Trump shared the picture intending to criticize NFL players - but it was taken out of context.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: A photo retweeted by President Donald Trump shows the widow of a veteran killed in the line of duty.

title: Is This a Photograph of Robert Mueller in Vietnam?
subtitle: Although Robert Mueller is a Vietnam veteran, a viral photograph doesn't actually show the former FBI director during the war.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Robert Mueller in Vietnam in 1969.

title: Are These Images of Tortured Nigerian Slaves in Libya?
subtitle: Although gruesome photographs were misrepresented by a Nigerian politician, men from sub-Saharan African countries are being auctioned as slaves in Libya, as witnessed by CNN.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Horrifying photographs posted on social media by a Nigerian politician depict slaves sold in Libya.

title: Do These Photographs Depict the Libyan Slave Trade?
subtitle: An emotive Facebook post about the slave trade in Libya used photographs that were either unrelated to the slave trade or whose sources are unknown.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A November 2017 Facebook post includes photographs that show the slave trade in Libya in 2017.

title: Do Photographs Capture Niagara Falls Frozen?
subtitle: A number of images capture the famous waterfall in a mostly frozen state, although many of them are misdated on the Internet.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show Niagara Falls frozen in 1911 and 2014.

title: Does This Photo Show George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway During the Spanish Civil War?
subtitle: The image from the Spanish Civil War features one of the famous authors, but not both.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph from the Spanish Civil War shows famed authors George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway in close proximity.

title: Does a Video Show Needlessly Wasted Food at an Ohio Walmart?
subtitle: A misleading viral video that purports to show wasted food at a store in Celina, Ohio in fact shows the aftermath of a devastating tornado and the ensuing loss of power.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Facebook Live video shows careless food waste at a Celina, Ohio Walmart.

title: Did President Trump Impatiently Dump Fish Food in a Japanese Koi Pond?
subtitle: An image showing President Trump dumping fish food into a koi pond was shared with misleading statements about his behavior.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump ignored instructions from Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe and impatiently dumped fish food into a koi pond.

title: Does a Photograph Show a Penile Burn from an Electric Fence?
subtitle: Photograph purportedly shows a medical patient who received a severe penile burn from urinating on an electric fence.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a patient who received a severe penile burn from urinating on an electric fence.

title: Was This Coyote Given a Bath After Being Mistaken for a Dog?
subtitle: The critter needed a good cleaning, regardless.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a coyote being given a bath after it was mistaken for a dog.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Little Girl Desperately Clinging to a Screen Door During a Hurricane?
subtitle: A video showing a little girl hanging on to a door on a windy day is real, but it was not captured during a hurricane.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A mishap involving a little girl, a swinging door, and a gust of wind was caught on video during a hurricane.

title: Mule vs. Mountain Lion
subtitle: Photographs show a mule shaking a dead mountain lion, not actually attacking and killing the big cat.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a mule attacking and killing a mountain lion.

title: Did the Red Cross Serve This Meal to Hurricane Victims?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a meal served by the Red Cross to victims of Hurricane Harvey in Texas was actually a picture of a school lunch from 2014.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a meal served by the Red Cross to victims of a hurricane in Texas.

title: Is This a Doctor Mourning a Woman Who Died During Childbirth?
subtitle: A photograph reportedly depicts a crying doctor mourning for a patient who died in childbirth after she had struggled with fertility.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts a obstetrician grieving after his patient gave birth to a long-awaited baby and then died.

title: Was Barack Obama Serving Meals in Texas During Hurricane Harvey?
subtitle: Images of the former president serving food appeared alongside claims that he was in Houston after massive flooding there, but the picture was actually taken during a 2015 charity event.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Former President Barack Obama was in Houston serving food to people affected by Hurricane Harvey.

title: Fake Photographs: Harvey Edition
subtitle: As usual, fake and misleading images were circulated on social media in the wake of a storm that brought catastrophic flooding to the streets of Houston.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A series of photographs show the impact of Hurricane Harvey.

title: Carjacker Run Over by Truck?
subtitle: Photographs purportedly showing a failed carjacker who was supposedly run over and killed by a truck he tried to commandeer don't tell the full story.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a failed carjacker who was run over by a truck after the driver pushed him under its wheels.

title: Did This Woman Confuse Spray Foam Insulation for Mousse?
subtitle: A photograph supposedly shows a woman who mistakenly used expanding foam insulation on her hair instead of hair mousse.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph shows a woman who mistakenly used expanding foam insulation on her hair instead of hair mousse.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Scarecrow Made from a Corpse?
subtitle: "This poor fellow trespassed on the wrong farmer's property."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a scarecrow made from a human corpse.

title: Is This a Real Video of a Thunderstorm Supercell?
subtitle: A video purporting to show a huge storm moving over a rural road was digitally manipulated, although it was created from a real photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a giant supercell moving over a rural road.

title: Bull Shark Caught in Ohio River?
subtitle: A shark supposedly caught in the Ohio River near Indiana was actually captured from the Brisbane River in Australia.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a bull shark caught in the Ohio River near Indiana.

title: 28-Ft. Florida Alligator Photograph
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a 28-foot alligator captured in Florida is real but exaggerated.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a 28-foot alligator captured in Florida.

title: Does This Photograph Document the Ancient Stump of a Giant Tree?
subtitle: Jugurtha Tableland in Tunisia is a rock formation, not a vestige of forests that stretched miles into the sky.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the remains of an ancient tree trunk measuring more than two miles (3.2 km) wide.

title: Is This Muhammad Ali with All of His Winnings in 1964?
subtitle: A photograph of Muhammad Ali standing near piles of cash in a bank vault is often shared with inaccurate or misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Muhammad Ali with all of his winnings in 1964.

title: Is China's 'Panda Bear Solar Farm' Real?
subtitle: Although a panda bear-shaped solar farm was designed and built in China, an image that appears with the story is not a photograph but rather an artist's conceptual rendering.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a panda-shaped solar farm in China.

title: Was a 'Masturbating Man' Found in the Ruins of Pompeii?
subtitle: A miscaptioned photograph led to many jokes but little understanding.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the remains of a man who died while masturbating in Pompeii in 79 A.D.

title: Do 'Angel Flights' Release Flare Salutes for Fallen Soldiers?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing a plane releasing a flare salute to soldiers killed in battle is often shared with misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an "Angel Flight" releasing a flare salute in honor of the fallen soldiers it is transporting.

title: Were These Women Found Guilty of Witchcraft in Early 20th Century China?
subtitle: A photograph showing three women in a "cangue" is often shared with a backstory about witchcraft.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows three women being punished after they were found guilty of witchcraft in China in 1922.

title: Was a Giant Squid Carcass Found in Indonesia?
subtitle: Photographs that purportedly show a giant squid carcass that washed up on an Indonesia beach actually show a dead whale.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an unusually large squid carcass in Indonesia.

title: Do the Oldest and Weakest Wolves Really Lead the Pack?
subtitle: A photograph of a wolf pack is commonly shared with an inaccurate description of the behavior of wolves.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a wolf pack being led by the oldest and weakest members.

title: Was a Baby Born Holding an IUD?
subtitle: A newborn was photographed holding his mother's failed birth control device, but he was not born clutching it in his hand.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Photograph shows a newborn baby clutching an IUD in his hand.

title: Six Flags Roller Coaster Flooding
subtitle: A photograph of a roller coaster submerged by floodwaters was not taken in St. Louis in 2017.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts a Six Flags roller coaster under floodwaters in St. Louis in May 2017.

title: Are Two Oceans Meeting in This Photograph?
subtitle: Photographs purportedly capture the spot where two oceans merge in the Gulf of Alaska.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show the place where two oceans meet in the Gulf of Alaska.

title: Call Before You Dig! - Gas Main Explosion
subtitle: Photographs allegedly show a gas pipeline rupture and explosion caused by a neglectful backhoe operator.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Chevy Suburban Merges in Front of 18-Wheeler, Kills Baby?
subtitle: Images of a fatal collision in Georgia were misrepresented on social media to scold drivers about sharing the road with large trucks.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An Image depicts a fatal collision involving a Chevy Suburban that recklessly merged ahead of a tractor-trailer, resulting in the death of an infant.

title: Was a Japanese Baseball Stadium Repurposed as a Residential Neighborhood?
subtitle: A baseball stadium in Osaka, Japan, was repurposed to showcase model homes, not to house permanent residents.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a baseball stadium repurposed as a residential neighborhood.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Palestinian Boy Shot by Israeli Soldiers?
subtitle: A gripping photograph purportedly shows a Palestinian boy after he was shot in the heart by an Israeli soldier.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a Palestinian boy after he was shot in the heart by an Israeli soldier during the First Intifada.

title: Is a Photograph of a Salvation Army Bellringer's Sign About 'the Gays' Real?
subtitle: A photograph of an unknown individual protesting near a Salvation Army sign was miscaptioned as an image of an actual volunteer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts a Salvation Army bellringer holding a sign stating the group helps people, "just not the gays."

title: Was an Alien Caught on the Kerala, Karnataka Border?
subtitle: A video of a sick sun bear (Helarctos malayanus) was shared on social media along with the claim that it showed an alien caught in southern India.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an alien that was caught in southern India, near the shared border of Kerala and Karnataka states.

title: Is This an Image of 'Child Organ Trafficking Victims' in Thailand?
subtitle: Images of the Ghouta chemical attack of 2013 were repurposed alongside a tale of child organ trafficking in Thailand.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A gruesome image depicts children kidnapped and killed by organ traffickers in Thailand.

title: Did 'Offended Muslims' Attack a Christmas Tree?
subtitle: A video was claimed to document that angry Muslims "attacked" a Christmas tree in a Western mall, but the clip captured a post-Christmas event in Cairo.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video depicts angry Muslims in a Western mall tearing down a Christmas tree because it offended them.

title: Huge Crowd at Trump Rally in Panama City, Florida
subtitle: A conservative web site used a  photograph from a 2013 jazz festival claiming it pictured the audience at a recent Donald Trump rally.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A photograph shows a massive audience attending a Donald Trump rally in Panama City, Florida.

title: Does This Picture Show Daytona International Speedway Flooded?
subtitle: If you've seen one hurricane picture online, you've seen them all.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Daytona International Speedway flooded during Hurricane Matthew in October 2016.

title: Are German Police Wearing Chainmail to Defend Against Refugee Attacks?
subtitle: Photographs show members of German special forces wearing chainmail-like protective gear, but not because of an increase in refugee stabbing attacks.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show German police officers who started wearing chainmail in 2016 due to an increase in refugee stabbing attacks.

title: Is This Donald Trump's Solid-Gold Toilet?
subtitle: This is what our bathroom looked like after King Midas paid us a visit.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump's solid-gold toilet.

title: Abandoned Polish Wedding Chairs
subtitle: An intriguing image of chairs with trees growing through reportedly stems from an ill-fated wedding in Poland that was halted by the onset of World War II.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts chairs left in a Polish forest after a 1939 wedding was canceled due to the start of World War II.

title: Did the Last Surviving WWII Veteran March Alone in Memorial Day Parade?
subtitle: A photograph of the "last surviving veteran" of a WWII battle group marching in a Memorial Day parade was taken in Russia in 2007.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts last surviving veteran of a WWII battle group marching alone and crying in a Memorial Day parade.

title: Pride Parade Fire Hydrant Mishap
subtitle: An image depicts a man stabbed at an altercation between KKK members and opponents, not a Pride attendee injured attempting to stimulate himself with a fire hydrant.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts an overenthusiastic Pride attendee injured in an attempt to sexually stimulate himself with a fire hydrant.

title: Does This Photograph Show John McCain Meeting Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi?
subtitle: A photograph taken in Syria in 2013 purportedly captured Senator John McCain posing with ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows Senator John McCain posing with ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

title: Michelle Obama Hugging Daughter After Graduation
subtitle: A student with a quote from Prophet Muhammad on her graduation cap received a hug from First Lady Michelle Obama, but this student was not one of the First Daughters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows one of Michelle Obama's daughters wearing a graduation cap decorated in a quote from Prophet Muhammad.

title: Is This a Photograph of a Woman Beaten for Supporting Donald Trump?
subtitle: After a contentious Donald Trump rally in California, images of purportedly injured supporters circulated on Facebook, one of which was swiped from a TV show.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts a young female Donald Trump supporter covered in blood following an altercation at a California political rally.

title: Is This a Photograph of an Orphan Lying in Her Mother's Chalk Outline?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing an orphan lying in a chalk outline of her absent mother has a very different backstory.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows an orphan lying in the chalk outline of her absent mother.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Condor Killed in America?
subtitle: Photographs of humans hunting endangered species for sport always provoke outrage among viewers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of men with a recently killed condor in the United States.

title: Huge Bernie Sanders Rally in California
subtitle: A photograph does not show a massive Bernie Sanders rally in California, but rather a May Day march in Havana.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image shows a massive Bernie Sanders rally in California.

title: Does This Photograph Show Nigerian Christians Burned Alive by Muslims?
subtitle: DISTURBING IMAGE WARNING
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows hundreds of Christians who were burned alive by Muslims in Nigeria.

title: Is This a Picture of Gay Lions Mating?
subtitle: A photograph of mating male lions that raced around social and news media may not be exactly what it appears to be at first blush.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Photographs and videos show a pair of gay lions having sex.

title: Does a Video of a Fistulated Cow Document Abuse by the Dairy Industry?
subtitle: A video purportedly documenting abuse by the dairy industry actually shows a veterinary practice intended to benefit ailing cows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video documents that the dairy industry has invented a new way to abuse cows: cutting holes in them to improve milk production.

title: 'As the World Berned'
subtitle: A photograph that purportedly showed massive crowds near Washington Square Park for a Bernie Sanders rally was actually taken in Paris in January 2015.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photograph depicts massive rally for Bernie Sanders in Washington Square Park in April 2016.

title: Is This a Female Wolf Protecting a Male's Throat During a Fight?
subtitle: It is common to anthropomorphize animals and ascribe their behavior to human emotions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a female wolf protecting a male's throat during a fight.

title: El Paso Gun Battle
subtitle: Photographs purporting to be the scene of a shootout on the US-Mexico border were actually taken in Brazil in 2008.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Photographs show an attempted robbery in El Paso, Texas, that ended with all of the assailants shot by their would-be victim.

title: Animal Testing Conducted by MAC Cosmetics?
subtitle: The photograph actually shows a mass spaying and neutering event at the University of Florida - not animal testing.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows MAC Cosmetics testing its products on a group of cats.

title: Does This Video Capture a Weather Reporter Slapped in the Face by a Large Fish?
subtitle: A viral video showed a "weather reporter" getting smacked in the face by a flying fish during a broadcast, but the footage appeared to be faked.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A  video shows a "weather reporter" getting smacked in the face by a flying fish during a television segment.

title: Aborted Fetuses Found in Michigan Dumpster?
subtitle: A graphic image shows fetuses found along a riverbank in Nepal, not fetuses discovered in a Dumpster behind a Michigan abortion clinic.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An image depicts multiple late-term aborted fetuses discovered in a dumpster behind a Michigan abortion clinic.

title: Is This the Vatican Women's Rifle Team?
subtitle: "The Vatican decided that Nuns with Guns was not a good image for the Catholic Church ..."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the Vatican Women's Rifle Team.

title: MISCAPTIONED: JetBlue Plane Buried by Snow
subtitle: A photograph that purportedly shows a JetBlue airliner buried in snow is actually the product of a tricky camera angle.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a JetBlue airliner buried in snow.

title: MISCAPTIONED: Baby Elephant Talk
subtitle: The playful baby elephant seen in a touching photograph was zoo-born; he didn't lose his mother to poachers.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a man caring for an elephant whose mother had been killed by poachers.

title: MISCAPTIONED: Arnold Schwarzenegger's First Day in NYC
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing Arnold Schwarzenegger's first day in New York is actually a still from his first film.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Arnold Schwarzenegger's first day in New York.

title: MISCAPTIONED: Snowfall in Saudi Arabia
subtitle: Saudi Arabia experienced heavy snowfall in January 2016, but this photograph of snow-covered palm trees wasn't taken there.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows snow-covered palm trees in Saudi Arabia.

title: Does a Photograph Show a Frozen Spider Web?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly depicting a "frozen spider web" is actually a picture of an ice sculpture.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a frozen spider web.

title: Is This an X-Ray of a 900-Lb. Man?
subtitle: There is much unseen in our world, even among what appears to be in plain sight.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows an x-ray of a 900-pound man.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Dog Burned While Rescuing Its Family?
subtitle: What happens when a social media prank achieves its intended results.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a dog with a badly burned face suffered when the canine rescued its family from a fire.

title: Does a Photograph Show a 'Pro-ISIS Rally' in Michigan?
subtitle: A widely circulated image does not depict a "pro-ISIS rally" held in Dearborn, Michigan, but rather an anti-ISIS demonstration.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts a "pro-ISIS rally" held in Dearborn, Michigan, in December 2015.

title: Are These Red Cross Nurses on the Beaches of Normandy on D-Day?
subtitle: Nurses did provide vital medical aid to soldiers during World War II, but not as suggested in a viral photograph.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Red Cross nurses arriving on the beaches of Normandy on D-Day.

title: Freshwater Snark
subtitle: This photograph shows a real shark, but not on the shores of Michigan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph documents the capture of a rare freshwater Marquette shark off the coast of Muskegon, Michigan.

title: Are These Photographs of a Young Betty White?
subtitle: "Betty's classic beauty put her on over 300 magazine covers and books."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show actress Betty White when she was in her 20s.

title: Did a Man Spitefully Paint His Lawn Like a Flag?
subtitle: As the story goes, his HOA told him he could not fly an American flag, so he did the "next best thing."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts a man who painted his lawn to look like an American flag because his homeowners' association wouldn't let him fly one.

title: Does a Photograph Show Planned Parenthood's Founder at a KKK Rally?
subtitle: Margaret Sanger once addressed female KKK members in a bid to have her message heard as widely as possible, but she disparaged the group's mission.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph documents Planned Parenthood founder Margaret Sanger speaking to women of the Ku Klux Klan (KKK).

title: Did These Boys Disappear After Discovering a Treasure Map?
subtitle: A picture of them was supposedly slipped under their parents' front door one year later.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two young boys named Jason and Jimmy Garret who disappeared from their home in 1920 after discovering a treasure map.

title: The Great Pacific Garbage Patch
subtitle: A shocking photograph shows ocean debris directly resulting from the massive 2011 earthquake in Japan, not specifically the 'Great Pacific Garbage Patch.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the "Great Pacific Garbage Patch" that covers over 8% of the Pacific Ocean.

title: Does a Video Show the Effects of Drinking 24 Cans of Red Bull?
subtitle: A viral video captures a patient suffering from blunt force trauma flail chest, not from the deleterious effects of consuming two dozen cans of Red Bull energy drink.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows a man suffering the deleterious effects of drinking 24 cans of Red Bull.

title: Is This a Photograph of Wounded Female Veterans?
subtitle: A photograph of women with missing limbs is actually a picture of Brazilian amputees, not wounded veterans.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph show a group of wounded female veterans who have each lost one or both legs.

title: Did a Couple Kill a Dolphin by Urinating on It?
subtitle: Claims that photographs depict a couple who killed a dolphin by urinating in its blowhole were inaccurate, although it's true that handling dolphins can kill them.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photographs depict a couple posing with a dolphin that died because the woman urinated in its blowhole.

title: Is This a Photograph of a 12-Week Fetus?
subtitle: An image many have viewed as a photograph of first trimester fetus is actually a picture of a hand-painted resin doll crafted by an artist.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a 12-week-old fetus.

title: Is This a Picture of a 'Cheerleader' Sniper?
subtitle: A 'motivational poster' purportedly shows a former cheerleader turned Air Force sniper.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A "motivational poster" shows a former cheerleader turned Air Force sniper.

title: Is This a Real Compact German Public Parking Garage?
subtitle: "Talk about German efficiency!"
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show automobiles tightly packed in a compact German public parking garage.

title: Is This a Photograph of Early Suffragettes Eating Pizza?
subtitle: Photograph from 1921 purportedly captures early suffragettes in bathing suits eating pizza to annoy men.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A photograph from 1921 captures early suffragettes in bathing suits eating pizza to annoy men.

title: Do These Photographs Show a Hamas-Organized Wedding of Men and Young Girls?
subtitle: Photographs supposedly documenting a Hamas-organized mass wedding of adult men and pre-pubescent girls actually show young relatives of the brides and grooms.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Images document a Hamas-organized mass wedding of adult men and pre-pubescent girls in the Gaza Strip.

title: Is This the Exact Moment a Bullfighter Became an Anti-Bullfighting Activist?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly captures the moment torero Álvaro Múnera became an opponent of bullfights.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph captures the exact moment torero Álvaro Múnera became an opponent of bullfights.

title: Is This a Photograph of Tick Eggs?
subtitle: A photograph supposedly shows a clump of tick eggs found along an outdoor path, but its details are questionable.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A photograph shows a clump of tick eggs found along an outdoor path.

title: Is This a Picture of a Bunny at a L'Oreal Animal Testing Lab?
subtitle: An heart-rending image of a rabbit was deceptively repurposed for use in a protest against animal testing.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph depicts a rabbit subjected to animal testing at the L'Oreal cosmetic company's labs.

title: Striped Icebergs in Lake Michigan?
subtitle: Photographs show icebergs with multi-colored striping purportedly taken in Lake Michigan.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show icebergs with multi-colored striping taken in Lake Michigan.

title: Antarctic Wave
subtitle: Do photographs show ice formations in Lake Huron created by waves of water freezing in midair?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show ice formations in Lake Huron created by waves of water freezing in midair.

title: Are These Towering Snow Walls in Massachusetts?
subtitle: The walls are formed with specially-designed snow plows.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows snow walls lining a highway in Massachusetts.

title: Can These Frogs Survive After Freezing in Winter?
subtitle: An amphibian that lives in Alaska has an unusually high tolerance for freezing conditions.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a frozen Alaskan tree frog, a species that can survive for weeks with most of its body water frozen.

title: Welcome Home, Daddy!
subtitle: A viral photograph doesn't really show a pregnant woman waiting to welcome home a military husband who couldn't have fathered the child she's carrying.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a pregnant woman waiting to welcome home a military husband who couldn't have fathered the child she's carrying.

title: Does This Photograph Show the Offspring of a Woman Who Gave Birth to 69 Children?
subtitle: How many children Valentina Vassilyeva actually birthed is a subject of dispute, but this photograph definitely has nothing to do with her.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows the offspring of a woman who gave birth to 69 children.

title: Do These Photos Show Store Returns Full of Donated Toys?
subtitle: Pictures supposedly document toys from Christmas drives for the needy that were exchanged at Walmart in order to purchase beer and cigarettes.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Photographs document toys from Christmas drives for the needy that were exchanged at Walmart in order to purchase beer and cigarettes.

title: Were Pearl Harbor Photographs Recently Found in an Old Camera?
subtitle: Photographs of the Pearl Harbor attack that were supposedly recently found in an old camera stored in a foot locker actually come from a variety of sources.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show images of the Pearl Harbor attack taken by a sailor in December 1941 and recently found in an old Brownie camera stored in a foot locker.

title: Do White Businessmen Pay to Hunt African Children?
subtitle: A controversial photograph supposedly documents the practice of hunting African children for sport.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a white businessman posing with the body of a small black child he hunted for sport in Africa.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Missouri 'Nigger Hunting' License?
subtitle: Extant pieces of racist memorabilia serve as reminders of  20th century American racial attitudes.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The Missouri state government issued "nigger hunting" licenses.

title: Did a Bong Explosion Disfigure This Woman?
subtitle: "People came up to me all night telling me that my face made them want to throw up ..."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a young woman who was disfigured when her bong exploded.

title: Giant Mutant Spiders in Missouri?
subtitle: Photographs purportedly show giant mutant spiders produced by government DNA experiments in Missouri.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show giant mutant spiders produced by government DNA experiments in Missouri.

title: Did a Homebuyer Discover a Barn Full of Classic Cars on His Property?
subtitle: Photographs showing an "eclectic collection of old cars in a decaying building" inspired a hopeful backstory too good to be true.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a barn full of vintage automobiles discovered by the purchaser of a Portuguese farmhouse.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Saved Whale Saying 'Thanks'?
subtitle: A lovely (true) account of a rescued whale, but the photograph attached to it has nothing to do with the story.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a formerly ensnared whale thanking one of her rescuers.

title: Did Michelle Obama Refuse to Salute the U.S. Flag on Veterans Day?
subtitle: Using misleading photographs to impugn the patriotism of the Obamas became a cottage industry.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows Michelle Obama not saluting the flag during a 2011 Veterans Day ceremony.

title: Did Barack Obama Fail to Salute the Flag at Arlington on Veterans Day?
subtitle: The real issue here is not disrespect for the flag, but that it's unseemly for one to salute himself.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows President Obama not saluting the flag during the playing of the national anthem at a 2009 Veterans Day ceremony.

title: Thai 'Cannibalism' Photographs
subtitle: WARNING -- DISTURBING IMAGES: Photographs purportedly showing people in Thailand carving up and consuming a human body actually depict a very different activity.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show people in Thailand carving up and consuming a human body.

title: Chief of the Kayapó Devastated
subtitle: "We have decided that your word is worth nothing. The conversation is over."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows the chief of Brazil's Kayapó tribe weeping over the approval of a hydroelectric dam project that would destroy tribal forest areas.

title: Are These Real Photos of Tom Hanks at a Diner?
subtitle: "Can you imagine finding these on your phone after a drunken night out?"
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show actor Tom Hanks posing with a drunk, passed-out customer in a diner.

title: Bicycle Tree
subtitle: A photograph is said to show a tree that grew around a bicycle left behind by a boy who went off to war.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a tree that grew around a bicycle left behind by a boy who went off to war.

title: Volkswagen's Levitating Car
subtitle: A levitating car developed by Volkswagen exists only as a concept that was given form for display at an automobile show in China.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A video shows a levitating car developed by Volkswagen in China.

title: Fan Belt
subtitle: Photographs show a damaged jet engine repaired with seatbelts during a refueling stop?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a damaged jet engine repaired with seatbelts during a refueling stop.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Deer with Tumors Caused by Monsanto's Roundup?
subtitle: Cutaneous fibromas (warts) occur among white-tailed deer due to a phenomenon caused by a virus, not environmental hazards.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a deer tumors caused by eating plants sprayed with Monsanto's Roundup herbicide.

title: 'Merry Christmas from Behind Bars' Holiday Card?
subtitle: A Christmas card featuring a family photograph taken in jail appears to be a repurposed use of a non-holiday image.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows a Christmas card featuring a family photograph taken in jail.

title: Does a Photograph Show a Panda Hugging a Policeman in Japan?
subtitle: A touching photograph has nothing to do with Japan, an earthquake, or a policeman.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a panda in Japan hugging a policeman's leg after an earthquake.

title: Look What Arizona Found!
subtitle: Photographs supposedly show a cache of weapons confiscated from a site on the Arizona border.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a cache of weapons confiscated from a site on the Arizona border.

title: Shovel-Selling Pole Dancer
subtitle: A child's drawing supposedly showing mom trying to sell a shovel at Home Depot looks suspiciously like a pole dance.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A child's drawing seemingly depicts mom as a pole dancer when in reality she was a Home Depot clerk trying to sell a shovel.

title: Is This the 'Strongest Dog in the World'?
subtitle: The 'strongest dog in the world' reportedly works 'in the Russian army special forces.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows the "strongest dog in the world," who works "in the Russian army special forces."

title: Are These Photos of an Alligator Attack on a Golfer?
subtitle: Yet another reason to avoid water traps.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a golfer whose arm was torn off by an alligator.

title: Was a Homeowner Trapped While Installing Christmas Decorations?
subtitle: A photograph that appeared to show a dangling homeowner in need of help was merely a humorous Christmas display.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a holiday display depicting a homeowner trapped by a fallen ladder while installing Christmas decorations.

title: Astronaut Carving Found on Ancient Spanish Cathedral
subtitle: The figure of an astronaut carved into the wall of a centuries-old Spanish cathedral is actually a modern creation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show the figure of an astronaut carved into the wall of a 12th century Spanish cathedral.

title: Inside the Green Zone
subtitle: Do photographs show a suicide bomber killed in Iraq's Green Zone?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a suicide bomber killed in Iraq's Green Zone

title: Crocodile in New Orleans
subtitle: Do photographs show a 21-foot crocodile found swimming in the streets of New Orleans?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a 21-foot crocodile found swimming in the streets of New Orleans.

title: Does This Photograph Show a Workmen's Van Trapped by Bollards?
subtitle: An image of inattentive workmen who have accidentally trapped their van within a barrier of bollards may not be what it seems.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows workmen who accidentally trapped their van within a barrier of bollards.

title: Were Baby Copperhead Snakes Discovered in a Potted Plant?
subtitle: "I tried to get the plastic pot out of the glass one by wedging a knife around the sides.  When I did this, something moved."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show baby copperhead snakes discovered in a potted plant.

title: Purell Hand Sanitizer Burn Warning
subtitle: Gel hand cleaner is often difficult to ignite and can be extinguished relatively easily.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Images document an employee whose hands caught on fire when he lit a cigarette after using a hand sanitizer product.

title: Do These Photographs Show a Tiger Nursing Piglets?
subtitle: Photographs claiming to show a mother tiger at a California zoo who nursed a group of piglets after her own cubs died are mislabeled.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A mother tiger at a California zoo nursed a group of piglets after her own cubs died.

title: Is This a 'Polar Vortex' in Chicago?
subtitle: Photographs ostensibly show vehicles in Chicago encrusted with ice from severe cold weather.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show vehicles in Chicago encrusted with ice from severe cold weather.

title: Were These Sea Creatures Washed Up by a Tsunami?
subtitle: These deep-sea creatures were not found scattered throughout the wreckage pf a tsunami.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show unusual deep-sea creatures washed up by the March 2011 Japanese tsunami.

title: Thanks, Kalat
subtitle: Does a photograph show a statue of a U.S. soldier crafted by an Iraqi sculptor?
author: David Mikkelson

title: Is This a Real Fetal Surgery Photo?
subtitle: A photograph supposedly captured a fetus reaching out towards the surgeon during an in-the-womb surgery.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a fetus reaching out towards the surgeon during an in-the-womb surgery.

title: Is This a Cat with a 'Lion Cut'?
subtitle: It takes more than fur to make a feline into a lion.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a domestic cat accidentally given a "lion cut."

title: Are Human Fetuses 'Taiwan's Hottest Dish'?
subtitle: Photographs showing a man supposedly eating a dead baby served at a Taiwan restaurant originated with a piece of performance art.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Photographs shows a man eating a dead baby served at a Taiwan restaurant.
